meanings.definition: Make someone liable or inclined to a specified attitude, action, or condition before it occurs.
meanings.sent1: Eating too much junk food can predispose you to health problems.
meanings.sent2: Regular exercise can predispose individuals to a positive mindset.
meanings.sent3: His love for adventure predisposed him to always seek new challenges.
meanings.sent4: Her optimistic nature predisposed her to see the bright side of every situation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's encouragement predisposed the students to believe in their abilities.

meanings.definition: Make someone more likely to suffer from a particular disease or condition.
meanings.sent1: Genetic factors can predispose individuals to certain illnesses.
meanings.sent2: Lack of sleep can predispose you to catching a cold.
meanings.sent3: His constant exposure to germs predisposed him to getting sick often.
meanings.sent4: Living in a polluted area can predispose residents to respiratory issues.
meanings.sent5: Poor diet choices can predispose people to various health problems.
